alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Stone, southern Searcy, southeastern Newton, northern Van Buren and northeastern Pope Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 900 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smyrna, or 20 miles southwest of Marshall, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall... Thola... Kay... Witts Spring... Rocky Hill... Moore... Dabney... Smyrna... Bohannon... Elba... Woolum... Imo... Old Lexington... Elberta... Watts... Leslie... Ben Hur... Alco... Canaan... Landis... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for north central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until noon CDT for central and north central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for north central Arkansas.
